name: CDSHooksRequest
title: CDSHooks Request (Logical Definition)
description: This structure is defined to allow the FHIR Validator to validate a CDSHooks Request Body. TODO: This content will be moved to the CDS Hooks specification in the future

element.short: The response to the discovery endpoint
element.definition: The response to the discovery endpoint

constraint.human: if fhirAuthorization details are provided, a fhirServer SHALL be specified

element.short: The hook that triggered this CDS Service call
element.definition: The hook that triggered this CDS Service call

element.short: A universally unique identifier (UUID) for this particular hook call
element.definition: While working in the CDS Client, a user can perform multiple actions in series or in parallel. For example, a clinician might prescribe two drugs in a row; each prescription action would be assigned a unique hookInstance. This allows a CDS Service to uniquely identify each hook invocation
element.comment: Note: the hookInstance is globally unique and should contain enough entropy to be un-guessable.

element.short: The base URL of the CDS Client's FHIR server
element.definition: The base URL of the CDS Client's FHIR server. If fhirAuthorization is provided, this field is REQUIRED. The scheme MUST be https when production data is exchanged

element.short: A structure holding an OAuth 2.0 bearer access token granting the CDS Service access to FHIR resources, along with supplemental information relating to the token
element.definition: A structure holding an OAuth 2.0 bearer access token granting the CDS Service access to FHIR resources, along with supplemental information relating to the token

constraint.human: If the granted SMART scopes include patient scopes (i.e. 'patient/'), the patient field SHOULD be populated to identify the FHIR id of that patient.

element.short: This is the OAuth 2.0 access token that provides access to the FHIR server
element.definition: This is the OAuth 2.0 access token that provides access to the FHIR server

element.short: The lifetime in seconds of the access token.
element.definition: The lifetime in seconds of the access token.

element.short: The scopes the access token grants the CDS Service
element.definition: The scopes the access token grants the CDS Service

element.short: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier of the CDS Service, as registered with the CDS Client's authorization server
element.definition: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier of the CDS Service, as registered with the CDS Client's authorization server

element.short: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier of the CDS Service, as registered with the CDS Client's authorization server
element.definition: The OAuth 2.0 client identifier of the CDS Service, as registered with the CDS Client's authorization server

element.short: Hook-specific contextual data that the CDS service will need
element.definition: Hook-specific contextual data that the CDS service will need

element.short: Key/value pairs of FHIR queries the CDS Client provides on each call
element.definition: An object containing key/value pairs of FHIR queries that this Request is requesting the CDS Client to perform and provide on each Request call. The key is a string that describes the type of data being requested and the value is a string representing the FHIR query

element.short: Key of FHIR query - name for client to use when sending to Request
element.definition: Key of FHIR query - name for client to use when sending to Request

element.short: Value of FHIR query - FHIR Query for client to perform
element.definition: Value of FHIR query - FHIR Query for client to perform
